modelDescription: Distinguishing meaningful information from irrelevant data and designing systems that amplify signal over noise

curatedHighlights.curatorReason: Shannon's definitive information theory - information resolves uncertainty, signal through noise principle
Perfect example of signal vs noise in system design with car dealership feedback loops

book.title: The Noise Bottleneck: When More Information Is Harmful
book.author: fs.blog

curatedHighlights.curatorReason: Brilliant insight showing how more frequent data observation increases noise ratio - counterintuitive but crucial

book.title: The Noise Bottleneck: When More Information Is Harmful
book.author: fs.blog

curatedHighlights.curatorReason: Shows the paradox that more information can reduce understanding - vital for information diet
Actionable insight about curating information flows to improve thinking quality
Shannon's 5-part communication system and information vs meaning distinction

book.title: #228 Elad Gil: How to Spot a Billion-Dollar Startup
book.author: The Knowledge Project with Shane Parrish

curatedHighlights.curatorReason: Different types of information advantage - finding, weighing, access, and unique interpretation
Strange attractors as signal in chaotic dynamic systems - patterns emerge from noise
Information flows as key leverage point in system design - creates accountability and transparency
Henry Singleton's singular focus removing noise to focus on signal - practical example of information filtering

modelDescription: How information spreads and influences collective behavior through availability heuristics and media attention

curatedHighlights.curatorReason: Definitive explanation of availability bias and how media stories distort probability perception
Clear, concise definition of availability bias and how recent information distorts objective reality
Shows how personalized algorithms and filter bubbles amplify availability bias in digital age
Direct connection between media coverage and perceived importance - core availability cascade mechanism
What you see is all there is - explains how limited information creates overconfidence

book.title: Same as Ever: A Guide to What Never Changes
book.author: Morgan Housel

curatedHighlights.curatorReason: Law of large numbers means rare events happen daily globally - availability cascade fuel
Shows when to rely on base rates vs intuition - distinguishes normal vs power law environments
Confirmation bias as complement to availability - both distort information processing
Information availability as key dimension in decision-making under uncertainty
Too much information can complicate rather than improve decisions - connects to availability cascades

modelDescription: How the mind constructs reality from information through prediction rather than direct perception

curatedHighlights.curatorReason: Perfect articulation of predictive processing theory - we experience predictions, not direct reality

book.title: From Many to (N)one: Meditation and the Plasticity of the Predictive Mind
book.author: sciencedirect.com

curatedHighlights.curatorReason: Detailed explanation of how meditation affects predictive hierarchies and precision weighting
Shows recurrent processing and integrated information theory connecting to predictive processing
Paradigms as transformation glasses - we see what our conceptual experience teaches us to see
Connectionist knowledge and belief web - how our predictive models are built from connections
Sleep cycles as information processing stages - reception, reflection, integration model

book.title: Mapping the Mind of a Large Language Model
book.author: anthropic.com

curatedHighlights.curatorReason: AI feature clustering shows how predictive models organize conceptual similarity

book.title: This Is Water by David Foster Wallace
book.author: fs.blog

curatedHighlights.curatorReason: Different belief templates create different meanings from same experience - classic predictive processing example
Superposition hypothesis shows how neural networks compress and predict - mirrors predictive processing
Cessation as complete shutdown of predictive processing - ultimate demonstration of constructed experience
